forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southwest wind 7 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As night envelops Downtown San Francisco, a soft rain gently falls, whispered by the winds that sweep through the streets. Expect dampness before dawn dissipates into the promise of a brighter Thursday. Tonight’s low settles at a crisp 52, hinting at a chill in the air, soon to lift as temperatures rise to a more comfortable 54 under a mostly cloudy sky. The south-southwest wind plays its part, creating a soothing symphony, with gusts that dance playfully at 29 mph. The likelihood of rainfall hangs at a significant 90%, though it remains light—likely less than a tenth of an inch, leaving only a glistening trace on the sidewalks.

Tomorrow brings a welcome transition, as the sun begins its reign with a high near 62. Overcast will give way to brilliant clarity, though the afternoon might cool slightly to around 60. A gentle west wind will encourage the lingering warmth through its subtle gusts. While the evening wears its misty cloak, tonight is not one for outdoor ventures; perhaps a quiet gathering indoors with a good book or spirited conversation would cast a cozy glow. Those venturing out might opt for a light jacket, shielding from the damp, while embracing the serenity of a city lulled by the rhythm of the rain.
